required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Patients With Primary Open Angle Glaucoma or Ocular Hypertension Who Were Insufficiently Responsive to Monotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: This is a retrospective chart review and will assess changes in IOP after treatment with any fixed combination in patients who previously received monotherapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Intraocular Pressure (IOP)
primary_outcome.description: IOP is a measurement of the fluid pressure inside the eye. A negative change from baseline indicates an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Assessment of Tolerability Using a 4-Point Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Patient assessment of tolerability using a 4-point scale (very good, good, moderate, and poor). The percentage of patients assessed as good and very good combined are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician Assessment of Tolerability Using a 4-Point Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Physician assessment of tolerability using a 4-point scale (very good, good, moderate, and poor). The percentage of patients assessed as good and very good combined are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Who Maintained Better Compliance With Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients who maintained better compliance with treatment than prior therapy was assessed by the patient on a 3-point scale (better, equal, and worse compliance).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Continuing on Therapy After 12 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients continuing on therapy after 12 weeks was assessed as Yes or No.

arm_group.description: Patients with POAG or OHT previously treated with monotherapy and currently treated with any fixed combination therapy

intervention.description: Patients with POAG or OHT previously treated with monotherapy and currently treated with any fixed combination therapy. This was a retrospective chart review study, so no treatment was administered in this study.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with Primary Open Angle Glaucoma or Ocular Hypertension

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of glaucoma or ocular hypertension
- Previously treated with monotherapy followed by fixed combination therapy for at least 12 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
